intro: Epilobium radoi, commonly known as the Radoi willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils, such as along riverbanks and in wet meadows. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers in racemes, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and the stems are often reddish in color. Epilobium radoi is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their ornamental value.
